Upgrade Courier.description: Upgrades your team's Animal Courier to a Flying Courier, granting it swift, unobstructed movement to carry items to and from your team's base. Requires a deployed Animal Courier.

notes.note: The Flying Courier is not a valid target for most spells. A list of spells which affect the courier can be found below .
The Flying Courier takes 50% more damage from melee attacks than from ranged attacks.
It is possible to have multiple Flying Couriers. However, only the first created courier reacts on the courier button.
All couriers are controllable by the entire team, no matter who buys and deploys the courier.
When a courier dies, the opposing team's heroes get 175 gold each. If there already is a dead courier, no gold is granted.

subnotes.note: However, an enemy making the killing blow on a courier always gets the 175 gold bounty.

notes.note: The Flying Courier is invulnerable when near its team's fountain .
When a Flying Courier dies, it respawns in 180 seconds at the team's fountain. While dead, items in its inventory are inaccessible.

Flying Courier.lore: The faithful mount upon which soar the fortunes of battle.
additional_info: Becomes available for purchase at the 3 minute mark.
It takes 3 minutes for the Flying Courier to replenish in the stock.
Flying Courier is completely shareable .

This item acts as a recipe to upgrade the Animal Courier . Buying it automatically upgrades the Animal Courier (wherever it is) . However, unlike other recipes, it does not combine into one item when the Animal Courier and the Flying Courier items are in the inventory.
However, unlike other recipes, it does not combine into one item when the Animal Courier and the Flying Courier items are in the inventory.

modifiers.value: Bashed: Dispellable with strong dispels.

Bash.description: Grants each attack a chance to stun the target for 1.4 seconds and deal 85 bonus damage, based on whether the equipped hero is ranged or melee.

notes.note: Skull Basher's bash does not stack with the bash of Abyssal Blade and other Skull Bashers.
When obtaining multiple items with the bash ability, only the one that has been continuously the longest in the inventory works.
The mini-bash ability of Monkey King Bar is not treated as a bash, and it works fully independently from other bashes.
The bonus damage from Bash can be lifestealed off. However, it cannot crit or cleave .
The damage can be reduced with e.g. Enfeeble or Static Link .

subnotes.note: However, it cannot be amplified with e.g. Empower or the Double Damage Rune .

notes.note: Adds an average of 21.25 damage to every attack for melee heroes, and 8.5 damage for ranged heroes.
Does not work against wards and buildings , but works against allied units.
Bash uses pseudo-random distribution .

additional_info: When held by Slardar , Spirit Breaker , Troll Warlord or Faceless Void , Bash cannot proc.
One Skull Basher grants a total of 200 health , 0.6 health regeneration and 10 (20 to strength heroes) attack damage .

special_details.NO_PIERCE_SPELL_IMMUNE: While spell immune, Infused Raindrop does not react on magical damage.

Magical Damage Block.description: Consumes a charge to block 120 magic damage from damage instances over 50 damage. Comes with 5 charges. When the charges are gone, the item disappears.

notes.note: Only procs on magical damage equal to or greater than 50 ( before reductions ), not including self-inflicted damage and damage dealt by allies.

subnotes.note: When procced, blocks up to 120 magical damage (before reductions).
Also ignores every form of damage amplification , including spell damage amplification.
Has the highest priority in the group of damage negating spells, blocking damage before any of them do.
Has a higher priority than Dispersion and Blade Mail , meaning it first blocks damage before they spread it.
Has a lower priority than Mana Shield , meaning Mana Shield first reduces damage before Raindrop blocks it.

notes.note: Neither consumes charges nor blocks any damage while on cooldown.

additional_info: Becomes available for purchase at the 3 minute mark.
After that, it has a 1 second restock time.

Infused Raindrops do not stack in the inventory. Each of them requires its own slot. Their regeneration does stack. They lose charges at the same time, although only one of them actually blocks damage.
Stacks multiplicatively with other sources of magic resistance .
Increases most heroes' total magic resistance to 36.25%, assuming basic 25% magic resistance and no other sources of magic resistance.
Increases Meepo 's and Visage 's total magic resistance to 44.75% and 23.5% respectively, assuming their basic magic resistance and no other sources of magic resistance.

modifiers.value: Tango Heal: Undispellable.

Eat a Tree or Ward.description: Consume a target tree or ward to gradually restore health. Comes with 4 charges. Can be used on an allied hero to give them one Tango.

notes.note: When cast on trees , enemy Observer Ward s and Sentry Ward s, it destroys the target and heals the user.

subnotes.note: When targeting wards or trees placed by Iron Branch , the heal duration is doubled.
Restores health in the form of health regeneration, so it heals for 0.72 health in 0.1 second intervals (7.19 health per second).
One set of Tangoes can heal for up to 460 (920) health.
Successive uses with the same unit do not stack, but refresh the duration instead.
Cannot be cast on any other ward than enemy Observer and Sentry Wards.

notes.note: When targeting an allied hero, it creates a Tango (Shared) in the targeted ally's inventory, instead of healing the user.

subnotes.note: If the targeted ally's inventory is full, the item is dropped on the ground.
Can also be cast on creep-heroes , only giving Spirit Bear and Familiar s a charge, otherwise having no effect.

additional_info: Stacks with itself in inventory, there is no stack limit. The sell-back price adapts based on the number of Tangoes in a stack.
A set of Tangoes is not shareable . However, it is possible to give allies a Tango (Shared) by casting it on them.

modifiers.value: Black King Bar Immune: Undispellable.

Avatar.description: Grants Spell Immunity and 100% Magic Damage Resistance. Duration and cooldown decrease with each use. Some abilities are able to disable through Avatar.

notes.note: Interrupts the user's channeling spells upon cast.
Applies spell immunity for the duration and a basic dispel upon cast.
During Avatar, the hero cannot be affected by Ghost Scepter or by Ethereal Blade . These buffs get removed immediately.
Causes the user's model size to increase by 30% for its duration. This has no impact on its collision size.
The duration of Avatar is bound to the hero. Re-buying Black King Bar does not reset it.
For more details, including a list of spells which are not blocked, see Spell immunity .

additional_info: One Black King Bar grants a total of 200 health , 0.6 health regeneration and 24 (34 to strength heroes) attack damage .

Attack Range Bonus.description: Increases attack range of ranged heroes by 140.

notes.note: Attack range bonuses from multiple Dragon Lances or Hurricane Pikes do not stack.
Stacks with any other source of attack range bonus.
Affects the cast range of active attack modifiers as well.
Does not affect the range of secondary attacks like Moon Glaive ​, Split Shot ​, Flak Cannon ​ or Marksmanship ​.
Affects the cast range of Focus Fire ​ as well, so it matches the total attack range.

Dragon Lance.lore: The forward charge of the wyvern host grants no quarter.
additional_info: One Dragon Lance grants a total of 240 health , 0.36 health regeneration , 2 armor and 14 attack speed (and 12 attack damage to Strength and 14 attack damage to Agility heroes).

modifiers.value: Truesight: Undispellable.

True Sight.description: Adds the ability to see invisible units and wards to any allied vision within its carrier's range.

notes.note: The True Sight is provided within the whole area, regardless of the carrier's actual vision. It is fully unobstructed.
The True Sight is provided by an aura which affects enemies. Its debuff lingers for 0.5 seconds.
Cannot detect units under the effect of Shadow Dance , Smoke of Deceit and Techies ' mines under the effect of an Aghanim's Scepter upgraded Minefield Sign .
True Sight does not work when the Gem is in a courier 's or in Lone Druid 's Spirit Bear 's inventory.

additional_info: Gem of True Sight is partially shareable .
The stock takes 10 minutes to replenish.
This item drops when its wielder dies, unless it has Reincarnation .
Gem of True Sight cannot be destroyed or sold.
One Reaver grants a total of 500 health and 1.5 health regeneration (and 25 attack damage to strength heroes).

special_details.ILLUSIONS_CAN_USE: Illusions always have the broken version in their inventory.

Break.description: Whenever you attack or are attacked, the 14 health regeneration and 25 Movement Speed are lost for 13 seconds.

notes.note: Reduces Tranquil Boots stats to +65 movement speed and 0 health regeneration .
Breaks upon successfully landing an attack on an enemy, or when an enemy successfully lands an attack on you.

subnotes.note: This means when your or an enemy's attack misses or is disjointed , the boots do not break.
The actual damage from the attack does not matter, even 0 damage attacks can break the boots.
The secondary attacks of Flak Cannon and Split Shot count, too, but the bounces of Moon Glaive do not.
Cleave , splash and Psi Blades cannot break the boots of secondary targets either.

notes.note: The cooldown is affected by the Cooldown Reduction of Octarine Core , Arcane Rune or $TALENT_UPGRADE$ talents .

subnotes.note: However refreshing it with ( Refresher Orb or Rearm ) does not skip the broken state. The cooldown timer vanishes, but the boots stay disabled for the remaining duration.

Tranquil Boots.lore: While they increase the longevity of the wearer, this boot is not particularly reliable.
additional_info: Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of boots do not stack.
Stacks with all other movement speed bonuses.
The health regeneration of multiple Tranquil Boots fully stacks.
Ring of Regen is partially shareable .

Mjollnir.lore: Thor's magical hammer, made for him by the dwarves Brok and Eitri.
additional_info: Mjollnir is very effective against heroes with illusions like Naga Siren , Spectre and particularly Phantom Lancer and Chaos Knight that can surround you because the lightning goes all around you compared to cleave.
This item is very good for pushing, you can apply the Static Charge on a creep to push a lane safely while you jungle and get extra gold.

special_details.PIERCE_SPELL_IMMUNE: Returned magical damage is reduced to 0.

modifiers.value: Item Blade Mail Reflect: Undispellable.

Damage Return.description: Reflects any damage taken back to the unit that dealt the damage. Lasts 4.5 seconds.

notes.note: Interrupts the user's channeling spells upon cast.
Returns the same damage type as received.
Returns incoming damage before all manipulations . However, damage manipulation on the enemy still affects the damage normally.
Reflected physical damage is affected by damage block as well.
The returned damage is always dealt right after the incoming damage.
Returned damage has the no-reflection flag , preventing its damage from interacting with other sources of damage with the same flag.
Fully ignores self-inflicted damage, and damage flagged as HP Removal .
Returns damage back to the source. This means damage done by summons is reflected back to the summons, not to their owner.
Damage Return has a global range and affects units through the Fog of War or invisibility .
Returned damage cannot be amplified with spell damage amplification and cannot spell lifesteal .
Does not work against wards , buildings and allied units.

additional_info: One Blade Mail grants a total of 6 armor , 110 mana , 0.4 mana regeneration , 0.71% spell damage and 22 (32 to intelligence heroes) attack damage .

Ultimate Upgrade.description: Upgrades the ultimate and some abilities of certain heroes.

notes.note: When a hero has an upgrade available, the item's and the upgraded spell's tooltip states what exactly is upgraded.
When a hero has no upgrades available, the ultimate ability gets a green note reading " This hero has no upgrade ".
Single target spells with Aghanim's Scepter upgrades that are reflected by Lotus Orb depend on whether the hero with the Echo Shell on has Aghanim's Scepter, not the original caster of the spell.

additional_info: One Aghanim's Scepter grants a total of 375 health , 0.6 health regeneration , 1.43 armor , 10 attack speed , 285 mana , 0.4 mana regeneration , 0.71% spell damage and 10 attack damage .

The following heroes cannot drop or sell Aghanim's Scepter once they have purchased it, due to receiving a new ability, or in case of Meepo an additional Divided We Stand clone: Earth Spirit , Lifestealer , Meepo , Morphling , Nyx Assassin , Ogre Magi , Timbersaw , Treant Protector , Tusk , and Zeus .
Earth Spirit , Lifestealer , Meepo , Morphling , Nyx Assassin , Ogre Magi , Timbersaw , Treant Protector , Tusk , and Zeus .

Damage Block.description: Gives a chance to block damage based on whether the equipped hero is melee or ranged.

notes.note: Does not work against wards ( Plague Ward , Mass Serpent Ward , Death Ward ).
Does not reduce physical damage from spells, except from Moon Glaive and The Swarm .
Damage Block uses pseudo-random distribution .
For more details, see Damage Block .

additional_info: Axe's high natural health regeneration combined with Stout Shield makes him much tougher in lane, especially after picking up another health regeneration item.

special_details.PARTIAL_PIERCE_SPELL_IMMUNE: Can proc on spell immune enemies. Cannot slow spell immune enemies. Slow persists if debuff was placed before spell immunity and when not dispelled.

modifiers.value: Echo Sabre Debuff: Dispellable with any dispel.

Echo Strike.description: Causes melee attacks to attack twice in quick succession. The double attacks apply a 0.6 second 100% movement and attack speed slow on each strike.

notes.note: This ability works exclusively for melee heroes.
Upon proccing, grants the user 490 attack speed until the next attack.

subnotes.note: This means it does not provide guaranteed full attack speed and can be countered by strong attack speed slows.
The attack speed has no set duration. It lasts until the user makes a second attack, no matter how long they wait.

notes.note: Since it is a simple attack speed bonus, it is possible to cancel the second attack and "store" the attack speed for later.
The second attack is not an instant attack . It uses regular attack animation times. This means it can proc any attack modifier normally.
The movement and attack speed slow is applied on the proccing attack and on the attack after the proccing attack.

subnotes.note: This means it is possible to slow 2 enemies with one proc, by switching attack targets after the proccing attack.

notes.note: The slow of multiple instances does not stack, but refreshes the duration instead.
Procs on anything, including buildings , wards and allies. The slow fully applies to allies, but not to buildings and wards.

Echo Sabre.lore: A deceptively swift blade imbued with resonant magic.
additional_info: One Echo Sabre grants a total of 200 health , 0.3 health regeneration , 10 attack speed , 120 mana , 0.4 (+75%) mana regeneration , 0.625% spell damage and 15 (25 to strength and intelligence heroes) attack damage .

modifiers.value: Item Phase Boots Active: Undispellable.

Phase.description: Gives increased movement speed and lets you move through units. The increased movement speed is based on whether the equipped hero is melee or ranged.

notes.note: Does not interrupt the user's channeling spells upon cast.
Allows the user to pass through other units, including wards , but not through buildings .
Checks the user's range type periodically and updates the speed bonus immediately if the range type changes.
When used constantly, increases the user's average movement speed by 7.5% if melee , and by 6.25% if ranged .

additional_info: Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of boots do not stack.
Stacks with all other movement speed bonuses.
One Gauntlets of Strength grants a total of 60 health and 0.18 health regeneration (and 3 attack damage to strength heroes).
Perseverance is partially shareable .
The magic resistance stacks multiplicatively with other sources of magic resistance.
Increases most heroes' total magic resistance to 47.5%, assuming basic 25% magic resistance and no other sources of magic resistance. Together with the aura, this is further increased to 52.75%.
Together with the aura, this is further increased to 52.75%.

Increases Meepo 's and Visage 's total magic resistance to 54.5% and 37% respectively, assuming their basic magic resistance and no other sources of magic resistance. Together with the aura, this is further increased to 59.05% and 43.3%.
Together with the aura, this is further increased to 59.05% and 43.3%.
Pipe of Insight does not inherit the attribute bonuses from Headdress .
Together with the aura , one Pipe of Insight grants a total of 12 health regeneration to the owner.

special_details.ILLUSIONS_PARTIAL_USE: Illusions do not benefit from the attack damage and armor and do not lose health per second. Illusions gain the strength over 0.6 seconds and copy the original's current health, resulting in them having 500 current health more than the hero if it was not at full health as the illusion was created.

modifiers.value: Item Armlet Unholy Strength: Undispellable.

Unholy Strength.description: When active, Unholy Strength grants +31 damage, +25 strength and +4 armor, but drains 45 health per second. You cannot die from the health drain when Unholy Strength is activated, nor from the strength loss when Unholy Strength is deactivated.

notes.note: Does not interrupt the user's channeling spells upon toggling.
Upon toggling on, it instantly provides the bonus attack damage and starts draining 5 health in 0.11 second intervals.
Grants 4.17 strength in 0.1 second intervals, so it needs 0.6 seconds to grant the full strength bonus.
The armor is granted after the 0.6 seconds, and not instantly.
Grants a total of 500 health (470 when considering the health drain) and 1.5 health regeneration .
Does not drain health while invulnerable or hidden .
Health drain cannot bring the user's health below 1. Does not toggle itself off when reaching 1 health.
Considering the passive health regen and the regen gained from the strength, it effectively costs 36.5 health per second.
When toggling off, all bonuses are instantly lost. However, it cannot bring the user below 1 health.
Unholy Strength does not persist through the user's death. If it was active upon death, the user respawns with it deactivated.
Multiple instances of Unholy Strength do not stack.

subnotes.note: If multiple Armlets are toggled on, turning off any Armlet removes the Unholy Strength buff.

Armlet of Mordiggian.lore: Weapon of choice among brutes, the bearer sacrifices his life energy to gain immense strength and power.
additional_info: Attack damage, attack speed, armor and health regeneration bonuses of multiple Armlets of Mordiggian do not stack.

One Armlet of Mordiggian grants the following: While toggled off, grants a total of 7 health regeneration , 5 armor , 25 attack speed and 9 attack damage . While toggled on, grants a total of 500 health , 8.5 health regeneration, 9 armor, 25 attack speed and 40 (65 to strength heroes) attack damage.
While toggled off, grants a total of 7 health regeneration , 5 armor , 25 attack speed and 9 attack damage .
While toggled on, grants a total of 500 health , 8.5 health regeneration, 9 armor, 25 attack speed and 40 (65 to strength heroes) attack damage.

modifiers.value: Item Dustofappearance: Dispellable with any dispel.

Reveal.description: Reveals and slows invisible Heroes in a nearby area.

notes.note: Interrupts the user's channeling spells upon using.
Places a debuff on enemies (including visible ones) within the radius upon cast. Leaving or entering the area afterwards has no effect.
Unlike the visual effect, the Reveal debuff is applied within the entire radius instantly upon cast.
Multiple debuffs do not stack, but refresh the duration instead.
Can place the debuff on units in the Fog of War and invulnerable units, but not on hidden units or on wards .
Cannot detect units under the effect of Shadow Dance and Smoke of Deceit (although the debuff is still placed on them).
Only slows units when they actually are invisible. This means during the fade time or fade delay of invisibility , the unit is not slowed.

additional_info: Stacks with itself in the inventory.
Dust of Appearance is completely shareable .
One Silver Edge grants a total of 300 health , 0.9 health regeneration , 2.14 armor , 45 attack speed , 165 mana , 0.6 mana regeneration , 1.07% spell damage and 45 attack damage .

modifiers.value: Item Headdress Aura: Undispellable.

Regeneration Aura.description: Restores health to allies in a 900 unit radius. Multiple instances of Regeneration Aura do not stack.

notes.note: Stacks with all other sources of flat health regeneration, except with Regeneration Aura from multiple Headdresses.
Regenerates up to 180 health in one minute.
Places the buff on illusions , but they do not benefit from it.
Does not affect wards , buildings and invulnerable units.
The aura 's buff lingers for 0.5 seconds.

additional_info: One Headdress grants a total of 40 health , health regeneration , 0.29 armor , 2 attack speed , 22 mana , 0.08 mana regeneration , 0.14% spell damage and 2 attack damage .

special_details.PARTIAL_PIERCE_SPELL_IMMUNE:
Can be cast on self while spell immune.
 Cannot be cast on spell immune enemies.

modifiers.value: Eul Cyclone: Dispellable with any dispel.

Cyclone.description: Sweeps a target unit up into cyclone, making them invulnerable for 2.5 seconds. Cyclone can be cast on yourself. Enemy units take 50 magical damage upon landing.

notes.note: Double clicking the item casts it on self.
Applies a basic dispel on the target upon cast.
Can only target enemies, self or own Meepo clones and Tempest Double s. Cannot target other allies, wards , or buildings .
Applies a cyclone effect on the target upon cast, so it dispels , turns it invulnerable and fully disables it.
While in the air, other units may pass below the cycloned unit.
The damage is applied at the end of the duration. If the cyclone gets purged, it still applies the damage as soon as the target lands.
The damage is only applied to enemy targets.
Can be cast on Roshan , but has no effect, since Roshan is immune to forced movement. The damage is still applied.

additional_info: Movement speed bonuses from multiple Eul's Scepters of Divinity fully stack.
Stacks with all other movement speed bonuses.
One Eul's Scepter of Divinity grants a total of 40 movement speed , 110 mana , 0.4 (+ 150%) mana regeneration and 0.71% spell damage (and 10 attack damage to intelligence heroes).
One Linken's Sphere grants a total of 300 health , 6.9 health regeneration , 2.14 armor , 15 attack speed , 165 mana , 0.6 (+ 150%) mana regeneration , 1.07% spell damage and 30 attack damage .
One Robe of the Magi grants a total of 66 mana , 0.24 mana regeneration and 0.43% spell damage (and 6 attack damage to intelligence heroes).
One Oblivion Staff grants a total of 10 attack speed , 110 mana , 0.4 (+ 75%) mana regeneration , 0.71% spell damage and 10 (20 to intelligence heroes) attack damage .
One Bracer grants a total of 120 health , 0.36 health regeneration , 0.43 armor , 3 attack speed , 33 mana , 0.12 mana regeneration , 0.21% spell damage and 6 (9 to strength heroes) attack damage .

special_details.ILLUSIONS_CAN_USE: Red critical numbers are before illusion and armor reduction.

Critical Strike.description: Grants each attack a chance to deal additional damage. Critical Strike does not work against buildings.

notes.note: Increases attack damage by an average of 40.5%.
The proc chances of multiple crit sources stack.

subnotes.note: If two sources of critical strike proc at the same time, the higher multiplier has priority.

notes.note: Critical Strike uses pseudo-random distribution .
Does not work against wards , buildings , and allied units.

additional_info: In the original DotA, this item was called the " Buriza-Do Kyanon ", a reference to a weapon (unique ballista) in Diablo II . "Buriza-do Kyanon" means "Blizzard Cannon" in Japanese.

Daedalus is the Latin transcription of the Greek "Daidalos" which means "clever worker" in Ancient Greek and Daedalus is also one of the characters in Ovid's "Metamorphoses" who was a skillful craftsman and artisan.
Considering Crystalys gives 34.5 + 15% effective damage; if you have 41 or more damage Crystalys is better value for your gold than Demon Edge .
One Ogre Club grants a total of 200 health and 0.6 health regeneration (and 10 attack damage to strength heroes).

Heaven's Halberd.lore: This halberd moves with the speed of a smaller weapon, allowing the bearer to win duels that a heavy edge would not.
additional_info: The evasion stacks diminishingly with other sources of evasion.
The evasion uses pseudo-random distribution .
One Heaven's Halberd grants a total of 400 health , 0.6 health regeneration and 25 (45 to strength heroes) attack damage .
One Octarine Core grants a total of 425 health , 700 mana , 1 mana regeneration and 1.79% spell damage (and 25 attack damage to intelligence heroes).

special_details.ILLUSIONS_CANNOT_USE: Illusions created during Flutter still have evasion and not the movement speed bonus.

modifiers.value: Item Butterfly Extra: Undispellable.

Flutter.description: Trade evasion for 35% additional movement speed for 4 seconds.

notes.note: Interrupts the user's channeling spells upon cast.
Only evasion granted by all Butterflies in the inventory is lost for the duration. Other sources of evasion still work.

additional_info: The evasion stacks diminishingly with other sources of evasion.
The evasion uses pseudo-random distribution .
One Butterfly grants a total of 5 armor , 65 attack speed and 30 (65 to agility heroes) attack damage .

One Abyssal Blade grants a total of 450 health , 15.6 health regeneration and 10 (20 to strength heroes) attack damage .

Anti-Mage needs Battle Fury to farm, since he is terrible without items and has trouble farming fast without it. Combined with Blink , he can flash-farm the jungle and quickly build his much needed items if not ganked.
One Mantle of Intelligence grants a total of 33 mana , 0.12 mana regeneration and 0.21% spell damage (and 3 attack damage to intelligence heroes).

modifiers.value: Item Hood Of Defiance Barrier: Undispellable.

Barrier.description: Creates a spell shield that absorbs up to 325 magical damage.

notes.note: Interrupts the user's channeling spells upon cast.
Blocks damage before any reductions , except when spell immune , during which it does not block any magical damage.
Recasting the ability refreshes the buff and resets the barrier's absorb capacity.
Does not stack with other magical damage barriers .

subnotes.note: If multiple sources of barriers are active on a unit, all of them lose capacity from the same absorbed damage instance.

notes.note: Does not share cooldown with Pipe of Insight .
Only blocks magical damage, not spell damage of other types.

additional_info: Stacks multiplicatively with other sources of magic resistance .
Increases most heroes' total magic resistance to 43.75%, assuming basic 25% magic resistance and no other sources of magic resistance.
Increases Meepo 's and Visage 's total magic resistance to 51.25% and 32.5% respectively, assuming their basic magic resistance and no other sources of magic resistance.
One Shiva's Guard grants a total of 15 armor , 330 mana , 1.2 mana regeneration and 2.14% spell damage (and 30 attack damage to intelligence heroes).

Place Sentry Ward.description: Plants a Sentry Ward, an invisible watcher that grants True Sight, the ability to see invisible enemy units and wards, to any existing allied vision within its range. Lasts 4 minutes. Hold Control to give one Sentry Ward to an allied hero.

notes.note: Provides 150 radius ground vision at its location for 12 seconds.
Cannot be placed inside the fountain area (including a small area in front of the ramp), or in Roshan 's pit.
Holding Control allows the owner to give an ally just one ward, instead of the whole stack.
It is not possible to give couriers or Spirit Bear a Sentry Ward by holding Control.
Sentry Wards can be targeted by enemy Tango es and Quelling Blade (including its upgrades) to be instantly destroyed.
Creep spawn ranges are shown before placing a ward, allowing camps to be blocked.

modifiers.value: Truesight: Undispellable.

True Sight.description: Adds the ability to see invisible units and wards to any allied vision within the Sentry Ward's range.

notes.note: The True Sight is provided in its whole area, it is not obstructed by anything.
The True Sight is provided by an aura which affects enemies. Its debuff lingers for 0.5 seconds.
Cannot detect units under the effect of Shadow Dance , Smoke of Deceit and Techies ' mines under the effect of an Aghanim's Scepter upgraded Minefield Sign .
The ability and modifier are not displayed in-game.

additional_info: Stacks with itself and with Observer Wards in inventory.
Sentry Wards are completely shareable .

modifiers.value: Blight Stone Buff: Dispellable with any dispel.

Lesser Corruption.description: Your attacks reduce target's armor for 8 seconds.

notes.note: Successive attacks with Blight Stone do not stack the debuff, but refresh the duration instead.
The target's armor is reduced before the attack damage is dealt, but still relies on the attack not to miss .
Works against wards and buildings , but does not work against allied units.
Fully stacks with the Corruption of Desolator .

additional_info: Shadow Walk helps Bounty Hunter get close enough to debuff targets with Blight Stone, and increases the damage from Jinada . Support Bounty Hunters can also built it into a Medallion of Courage later.
Monkey King Bar's True Strike works against every form of miss chance, not only evasion. This means it is also a viable pickup when the enemy has sources of blind .
The 35 % chance to mini bash can cancel a channeling spell and also teleportation.

Transmute.description: Kills a non-hero target for 200 gold and 1.85x experience. Cannot be used on Ancient Creeps.

notes.note: Upon cast, kills the target unit instantly and grants the caster 200 reliable gold and 185% of the target's experience bounty.
The target's default bounties are not granted. This means that no hero nearby gains the default gold and experience from the death.
Despite the visual effects, the gold and experience are granted instantly.
Deals damage equal to the target's current health to kill it. This damage fully ignores any form of reduction or amplification.

subnotes.note: This means that it triggers most on-damage events like (neutral or lane) creep aggro.

notes.note: Cannot be cast on couriers , wards , buildings , ancient creeps , Roshan , or Necronomicon summons.

notes.note: Interrupts the user's channeling spells upon cast.
Gains 1 charge whenever a visible enemy unit, including neutral creeps, uses an ability within the radius.

Can restore up to 255 health and mana when having the maximum amount of charges.

Shine.description: Temporarily removes the armor and evasion from Solar Crest. When cast on an ally it grants them 10 armor and 20% evasion. When cast on an enemy, it removes 10 of their armor and grants your allies to have 35% Accuracy on the target. Cannot target magic immune enemies.

notes.note: Cannot be cast on self.
Shares cooldown with Medallion of Courage .
Grants evasion for targeted allies, and accuracy to allies against targeted enemies.
The debuff on self and the buff on allies/debuff on enemies are independent from each other. Dispelling one does not dispel the other.
Unlike Medallion, Solar Crest does not place a debuff on the caster. Instead, its effects are directly bound to its cooldown.

subnotes.note: Its duration is always 7 seconds on the target, while the duration on self can vary when the cooldown gets manipulated.
This means when the cooldown is reduced, the reduction effects on self are briefer. The reduction effects on self also disappear immediately when the cooldown is refreshed.
This also means that the effects on self are applied when using Medallion of Courage, since they share a cooldown.

notes.note: The armor reduction on self fully stacks. When having multiple Solar Crests, each of them reduce armor when on cooldown.

subnotes.note: The evasion loss also affects all owned Solar Crests, but not any other source of evasion.

notes.note: The target buff and target debuff fully stack with each other. The effects on self also stack with the target debuff.

subnotes.note: When a unit is targeted by an allied and an enemy Solar Crest, it effectively has 13% evasion. This is the result of 20% evasion applying only 65% of the time (as the other 35% of attacks have accuracy).
When opposing heroes cast it on each other, they effectively have -20 armor, no evasion from Solar Crest, and attackers have 35% accuracy on them.
Multiple target debuffs or target buffs do not stack, but refresh their durations.
The target buff, target debuff and self-debuff fully stack with those applied by Medallion of Courage.

notes.note: Can be cast on any unit, except on wards and buildings.

additional_info: The evasion stacks diminishingly with other sources of evasion.

Chain Lightning.description: Grants a chance on attack to release a bolt of electricity that leaps between targets, dealing magical damage to each.

notes.note: Does not stack with the Chain Lightning of Mjollnir or other Maelstroms.
When obtaining multiple items with the Chain Lightning ability, only the one that has been continuously the longest in the inventory works.
The lightning bounces in 0.25 second intervals, so hitting max targets takes 0.75 seconds.
Does not bounce on invisible units or units in the Fog of War .
Can never hit the same unit twice per proc.
Can only proc on successfully hit attacks, thus missed attacks cannot proc.
All bounces together can deal up to 480 damage ( before reductions ).
Chain Lightning can proc while a previous chain lightning is still bouncing.
Chain Lightning uses pseudo-random distribution .
The Maelstrom Chain buff is a hidden buff required for the lightning to jump.
Chain Lightning does not use a regular cooldown. It is neither displayed on the item icon when proccing, nor is it affected by cooldown manipulating effects.

Maelstrom.lore: A hammer forged for the gods themselves, Maelstrom allows its user to harness the power of lightning.
additional_info: Maelstrom is the most cost effective damage item for heroes with a low Base Attack Time .

Maelstrom is a very good item for speeding up farming. If the extra experience is not needed, it is good alternative to the Hand of Midas . Since the lightning has a huge bounce range, it can be used to damage multiple camps at once when farming in the woods, if vision over the camps is present.

It is also great to deal with illusions or mass-summons like Broodmother 's spiders, Nature's Prophet 's treants, etc, especially useful for ranged heroes that lack area damage, since they cannot make use of cleave .

The Chain Lightning deals magical , so it ignores armor and Damage Block , making it good against heroes that get a Vanguard , or Tidehunter with his Kraken Shell , and against heroes with high armor like Dragon Knight or Terrorblade .
To counter someone with a Maelstrom you can buy an Infused Raindrop , it will completely block Chain Lightnings.

Note though that some spells are specifically coded to not be able to run multiple instances at the same time (e.g. Exorcism ). Before building Refresher Orb, be sure that the ability you aim to use it with supports multiple instances at the same time or is worth having its duration doubled.

Reduces Meepo 's and Visage 's total magic resistance to 18.75% and -12.5% respectively, assuming their basic magic resistance and no other sources of magic resistance.

additional_info: One Veil of Discord grants a total of 120 health , 6.36 health regeneration , 6.86 armor , 6 attack speed , 132 mana , 0.48 mana regeneration , 0.86% spell damage and 12 (18 to intelligence heroes) attack damage .

Place Observer Ward.description: Plants an Observer Ward, an invisible watcher that gives vision of its surrounding area to your team. Lasts 6 minutes. Hold Control to give one Observer Ward to an allied hero.

notes.note: Provides 1600 radius ground vision at its location.
Cannot be placed inside the fountain area (including a small area in front of the ramp), or in Roshan 's pit.
Holding Control allows the owner to give an ally just one ward, instead of the whole stack.
It is not possible to give couriers or Spirit Bear an Observer Ward by holding Control.
Observer Wards can be targeted by enemy Tango es and Quelling Blade (including its upgrades) to be instantly destroyed.
Creep spawn ranges are shown before placing a ward, allowing camps to be blocked.
While having the ward selected, multiple indicators appear on the world and minimap.

subnotes.note: The targeting courser depicts the ward, with a green circle around it. The circle shows its vision range.
The minimap shows a yellow area, depecting how much the ward would reveal when placed at that point.
The yellow markings consider trees and terrain height around the area.

notes.note: The ability and modifier are not displayed in-game.

additional_info: Observer Wards start with a stock count of 2 and are limited to a count of 4. It takes 150 seconds for 1 ward to replenish in the stock.
It takes 150 seconds for 1 ward to replenish in the stock.
Stacks with itself and with Sentry Wards in inventory.
Observer Wards are completely shareable .
Observer Wards do not provide True Sight .

special_details.ILLUSIONS_CANNOT_USE: Lifesteal particles are visible on illusions, but they do not gain health from their attacks.

Lifesteal.description: Heals the attacker for a percentage of attack damage dealt.

notes.note: The lifesteal stacks additively with other sources of lifesteal which are not Unique Attack Modifiers .
Cannot lifesteal off of wards , buildings and allied units.

additional_info: Lifesteal makes Troll Warlord much tougher in fights, and allows him to farm uninterrupted throughout the early to mid game.
One Mekansm grants a total of 100 health , health regeneration , 5.71 armor , 5 attack speed , 55 mana , 0.2 mana regeneration , 0.36% spell damage and 5 attack damage .

Energy Charge.description: Instantly restores health and mana based on the number of charges stored. Gains a charge (max 10) whenever a nearby visible enemy uses an ability.

mana.normal: Can restore up to 150 health and mana when having the maximum amount of charges.

notes.note: Interrupts the user's channeling spells upon cast.
Gains 1 charge whenever a visible enemy unit, including neutral creeps, uses an ability within the radius.
Does not gain charges from toggle abilities, active attack modifiers and the abilities listed here .
Passively triggered spells (e.g. Quill Spray , Borrowed Time , Multicast , Reincarnation ) do not add charges.
When an enemy casts a spell out of the invisibility from the Invisibility Rune , Shadow Walk , Sand Storm , Moonlight Shadow , Nature's Guise or Spin Web , it does not give a charge.
Can restore up to 150 health and mana when having the maximum amount of charges.
Shares cooldown with Magic Wand .
When having multiple Magic Sticks or Magic Wands in the inventory, the oldest one gains charges first. If it is full, the second oldest one starts to gain charges.
Upon upgrading a Magic Stick into a Magic Wand, all its current charges are carried over.

data.name: Health and Mana Restored per Charge

additional_info: Fragile support heroes often purchase a Magic Stick in the early game as a means to save themselves during ganks, or gain enough mana to use one last ability. Crystal Maiden Earthshaker Lion Ogre Magi Rubick Omniknight Treant Protector Vengeful Spirit Dazzle Shadow Shaman

special_details.NO_PIERCE_SPELL_IMMUNE: Blinds and attempts to damage if debuff was placed before spell immunity.
special_details.ILLUSIONS_CAN_USE:
Illusions deal less damage with Burn around them.
 The main hero's Burn always takes priority, if an enemy is within range of both the hero and its illusion.

modifiers.value: Item Radiance Debuff: Undispellable.

Burn.description: When active, scorches nearby enemies for 60 damage per second and blinds them, causing them to miss 17% of their attacks.

notes.note: Does not interrupt the user's channeling spells upon toggling.
The burn damage and blind effect are provided by an aura . Its debuff lingers for 0.5 seconds.

subnotes.note: This means during this linger period, enemies can still be damaged by up to one tick.

notes.note: Deals damage in 1 second intervals, starting 1 second after the debuff is placed.
The burn damage and blind effect of multiple Radiance do not stack. Only the first applied debuff applies the effects.
Does not affect buildings , ancient creeps and Roshan .

Radiance.lore: A divine weapon that causes damage and a bright burning effect that lays waste to nearby enemies.
additional_info: Radiance is most commonly purchased on Heroes who rely on long-lived illusions to farm and fight, either from an innate spell or in combination with Manta Style .

Damage Block.description: Blocks physical attack damage based on whether the equipped hero is ranged or melee. Poor Man's Shield will always block attacks from enemy Heroes, but has a 50% chance to block damage from creeps.

notes.note: Does not work against wards ( Plague Ward , Mass Serpent Ward , Death Ward ).
Does not reduce physical damage from spells, except from Moon Glaive and The Swarm .
Damage Block uses pseudo-random distribution .
For more details, see Damage Block .
Treats illusions as heroes and creep-heroes as creeps.

additional_info: One Poor Man's Shield grants a total of 0.86 armor and 6 attack speed (and 6 attack damage to agility heroes).

Demonic Summoning.description: Summons a Warrior and an Archer to fight for you for 50 seconds, whose strength and abilities increase as Necronomicon is upgraded. Warrior gains True Sight at level 3.

notes.note: Interrupts the user's channeling spells upon cast.
The summons always spawn in front of the caster.
All 3 levels of Necronomicon share cooldown.
Recasting this with the same Necronomicon replaces the summons from the previous cast, no matter under whose control they are.

subnotes.note: However, recasting it with a second Necronomicon (or the same with a different level) creates two new summons.

notes.note: The summons cannot be targeted by Helm of the Dominator and Hand of Midas .

subnotes.note: However, they can be targeted by other converting or instantly killing spells like Death Pact , Holy Persuasion or Devour .

Necronomicon.lore: Considered the ultimate in necromancy and demonology, a powerful malefic force is locked within its pages.
additional_info: Upgrading the item improves its stats and strengthens the summons from Demonic Summoning . Can be upgraded twice.
The total gold cost for each level is 2650/3850/5050.

One Necronomicon grants 160/240/320 health , 0.48/0.72/0.96 health regeneration , 165/231/264 mana , 0.6/0.84/0.96 mana regeneration and 1.07%/1.5%/1.71% spell damage (and 8/12/16 attack damage to strength heroes, or 15/21/24 attack damage to intelligence heroes) on each level.
When having a Demon Edge and a Radiance recipe in the inventory, buying Sacred Relic results in a finished Radiance , and not a Divine Rapier .

Switch Attribute.description: Changes selected attribute between Strength, Agility and Intelligence.

notes.note: Interrupts the user's channeling spells upon cast.
Switches from strength to intelligence, from intelligence to agility, or from agility to strength.
Current health and mana percentages stay unchanged upon switching attributes.
When having multiple Power Treads, each of them can be switched individually. The attribute bonuses fully stack.

Power Treads.lore: A pair of tough-skinned boots that change to meet the demands of the wearer.
additional_info: Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of boots do not stack.
Stacks with all other movement speed bonuses.
Attack speed bonuses of multiple Power Treads do not stack.
There are three ways to assemble Power Treads. Based on which item is chosen, the boot's initial status is different. The status can be switched freely after purchase.
Disassembling Power Treads returns the items which were originally used to build it. It is not based on the currently selected attribute.
One pair of Power Treads grants a total of:

special_details.NO_PIERCE_SPELL_IMMUNE: Root persists if debuff was placed before spell immunity and when not dispelled.

modifiers.value: Rod Of Atos Debuff: Dispellable with any dispel.

notes.note: The projectile travels at a speed of 1500 and can be disjointed .
Roots the target, preventing it from moving and casting certain mobility spells.

subnotes.note: Does not interrupt the target's channeling spells.
Provides True Sight over the target. Does not provide True Sight if applied during the fade time of invisibility spells.

notes.note: Successive casts on the same target do not stack, but refresh the duration instead.

additional_info: One Rod of Atos grants a total of 300 health , 0.9 health regeneration , 0.86 armor , 6 attack speed , 220 mana , 0.8 mana regeneration , 1.43% spell damage and 21 attack damage to strength heroes, 12 attack damage to agility heroes, or 26 attack damage to intelligence heroes.
Movement speed bonuses from multiple pairs of boots do not stack.
Stacks with all other movement speed bonuses.

modifiers.value: Clarity Potion: Dispellable with any dispel.

Regenerate Mana.description: Restores mana to the target unit over time. If the unit is attacked, the effect is lost.

mana.normal: Restores mana in the form of mana regeneration, so it restores 0.38 mana in 0.1 second intervals, which is 3.8 mana per second.

notes.note: Double clicking the item casts it on self.
If the target is more than 500 range away, the caster moves to the target until it is within 250 range before casting.
Can only target heroes (including illusions ) and creep-heroes .
The owner does not have to face the target to use this on it.
Successive casts on the same target do not stack, but refresh the duration instead.
Restores mana in the form of mana regeneration, so it restores 0.38 mana in 0.1 second intervals, which is 3.8 mana per second.
Fully stacks with other mana regeneration increasing effects.
Damage greater than 0 from any player (including allies and self) or Roshan dispels the effect.

subnotes.note: Does not get dispelled by damage flagged as HP Removal .

additional_info: Stacks with itself in inventory, there is no stack limit. The sell-back price adapts based on the number of Clarities in a stack.
Clarities are not shareable , however, they can be cast on allies.
Bloodstone cannot be put into the backpack .
Hyperstone is featured in the Dota 2 Gamescom trailer as an item for "swift" heroes that gives you "speed beyond measure".
